p: Overall, 13 patients tested positive for anti-HCV. HCV RNA was analysed in all cases and 2 patients had a detectable viral load, one with Burkittâ€™s lymphoma and the other with follicular lymphoma. These two patients were later treated with direct-acting antiviral agents and achieved a sustained virological response. Seven of the 11 (63.6%) patients with undetectable HCV RNA had been treated previously. Four (36.4%) were liver-transplant recipients undergoing chemotherapy for post-transplant lymphoproliferative disease (PTLD).
